oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mississippi Minstrels - 1949-06-10 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS syndication of KMOX (St. Louis, IL) radio program Mississippi Minstrels, originally broadcast June 10, 1949, part 1. Featuring 'interlocutor' Lambert Kaiman; the Mississippi Minstrel Band directed by Professor Stanley Daugherty; comedians Harry Fender, and Mose (played by Al Bland); and musicians Charlie Ackerson, Jerry Whittington (name unconfirmed), and the Magnolia Quartet. Written and produced by Al Bland.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Stanley Daugherty; Mississippi Minstrel Band; Harry Fender; Jerry Whittington; Mose
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer opening statement -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Lambert Kaiman) -- Announcer introduces Lambert Kaiman -- Lambert Kaiman introduces Professor Stanley Daugherty and the Mississippi Minstrel Band -- Alabamy Bound (Stanley Daugherty and the Mississippi Minstrel Band) -- Comedy routine (Lambert Kaiman, Harry Fender) -- Lambert Kaiman introduces Jerry Whittington -- By The Light Of The Silvery Moon (Jerry Whittington) -- Comedy routine (Lambert Kaiman, Mose) -- Lambert Kaiman introduces members of the Mississippi Minstrel Band -- Friendly Rival (Stanley Daugherty and the Mississippi Minstrel Band)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; KMOX (Radio station : Saint Louis, Mo.); Mississippi Minstrels (Radio program); Kaiman, Lambert; Ackerson, Charlie; Magnolia Quartet; Daugherty, Stanley; Mississippi Minstrel Band; Fender, Harry; Bland, Al
